item.title: Apizr v6.0, Refit's resilient manager - What's new
item.description: Apizr has been updated to v6.0, still getting all the things ready to use for web API client requests, with the more resilience we can, but without the boilerplate. item.title: Why I Prefer Exceptions to Error Values
item.description: Exceptions are often a better way to handle errors than returning them as values. We argue that traditional exceptions provide better user and developer experience, and show that they even result in faster execution.

item.title: What I’ve learned building MLOps systems for four years
item.description: As title says, I’ve worked on building MLOps systems for nearly four years. item.title: [tor-relays] Artikel 5 e.V. - Another police raid in Germany - general assembly on Sep 21st 2024
item.description: Hello to all list-reading entities! On Aug 16th 2024 German police considered it once again appropriate to raid the home&office at the registered address of our organization. The first raid was 2017. There are obviously still people working in German law enforcement today, who think that harassing a node-operator NGO would somehow lead to the de-anonymization of individual tor users. At least that is what they claim in the paperwork. As with the first time, the raid team was fortunately a bit ...
